qas.question: What obvious improvement does clothing bestow upon the wearer?
In what type of climate does clothing protect against sunburn and wind damage?
What property of clothing is important in cold climates?
What has seasonal and regional aspects?
What type of material tends to be worn in warmer seasons?
The least obvious improvement bestowed by clothing is what?
In cold climate clothing protects against sunburn and what?
What usually increases the functional need for clothing?
What property of clothing is important in hot climates?
More layers of clothing are generally worn when?

context: The most obvious function of clothing is to improve the <a0_0><b5_0>comfort<a0_0/> of the wearer<b5_0/>, by protecting the wearer from the elements. In <a1_0>hot<a1_0/> climates, clothing provides protection from sunburn or <b6_0>wind damage,<b6_0/> while in cold climates its <a2_0><b8_0>thermal insulation<a2_0/> properties<b8_0/> are generally more important. <b7_0>Shelter<b7_0/> usually reduces the functional need for clothing. For example, coats, hats, gloves, and other superficial layers are normally removed when entering a warm home, particularly if one is residing or sleeping there. Similarly, <a3_0>clothing<a3_0/> has seasonal and regional aspects, so that <a4_0>thinner<a4_0/> materials and fewer layers of clothing are generally worn <b9_0>in warmer seasons<b9_0/> and regions than in colder ones.
